actor_awards.notes: Discovered by Gene Kelly. Won the Golden Globe for Best Actress in a Drama and the BAFTA for Best British Actress for 'The L-Shaped Room'. Won a Primetime Emmy for her guest role in 'Law & Order: SVU' (2006).

filmography.title: An American in Paris
filmography.role_description: A young French shopgirl who becomes the object of affection for an American expatriate painter.
filmography.plot: Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.

filmography.title: Lili
filmography.role_description: A naive French orphan who joins a carnival and forms a bond with a puppeteer through his puppets.
filmography.plot: An orphaned waif joins a carnival and falls for a magician, but establishes a unique relationship with the puppets of a lame puppeteer.

filmography.title: Gigi
filmography.role_description: A young Parisian girl being trained as a courtesan who captures the heart of a wealthy playboy, leading him to choose marriage.
filmography.plot: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship, but it may not stay platonic for long.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: The L-Shaped Room
filmography.role_description: A pregnant, unmarried French woman who moves into a sordid London boarding house and finds love with a writer.
filmography.plot: A young French woman, pregnant and unmarried, takes a room in a run-down London boarding house where she befriends the other misfits living there.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actress

filmography.title: Fanny
filmography.role_description: A young woman in Marseille who marries an older man to provide a father for her unborn child after her lover goes to sea.
filmography.plot: In Marseille, a young woman pregnant by a sailor who has left for sea marries an older, wealthy sailmaker to provide for her child.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: Daddy Long Legs
filmography.role_description: A French orphan whose education is sponsored by a mysterious wealthy benefactor whom she eventually falls in love with.
filmography.plot: A wealthy American has a chance encounter with a young French woman and anonymously pays for her education in the US.

filmography.title: Father Goose
filmography.role_description: A prim French schoolmistress who, along with her students, invades the island sanctuary of a drunken beachcomber during WWII.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a man stationed on a South Sea island discovers a local schoolteacher and her students have been stranded there.

filmography.title: The Glass Slipper
filmography.role_description: A tomboyish, outcast version of Cinderella in this musical adaptation featuring ballet sequences.
filmography.plot: A musical adaptation of the Cinderella fairy tale, focusing on a misunderstood tomboy who finds love with the Prince.

filmography.title: Chocolat
filmography.role_description: A war widow in a conservative French village who rediscovers the joys of life through the protagonist's chocolate shop.
filmography.plot: A woman and her daughter open a chocolate shop in a small French village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.
filmography.awards: Screen Actors Guild: Nomination – Outstanding Performance by a Cast

filmography.title: Is Paris Burning?
filmography.role_description: The wife of a resistance leader who tries to save her husband from the Nazis during the liberation of Paris.
filmography.plot: The story of the liberation of Paris in August 1944 and the struggles of the various resistance factions.

filmography.title: Gaby
filmography.role_description: A French ballerina in London who falls for an American soldier during WWII, in this remake of 'Waterloo Bridge'.
filmography.plot: A French ballerina falls in love with an American paratrooper in World War II London, but tragedy strikes when he is reported killed.

filmography.title: The Man with a Cloak
filmography.role_description: A young French woman who travels to New York to secure funds for her revolutionist lover and becomes involved in a mystery.
filmography.plot: A young woman arrives in New York in 1848 and finds herself in a house of intrigue involving a wealthy invalid and a mysterious poet.

filmography.title: The Story of Three Loves
filmography.role_description: A governess who dreams of love and is transformed for one evening in the segment 'Mademoiselle'.
filmography.plot: Three stories about love on an ocean liner: a ballet dancer, a governess, and a trapeze artist find romance.

filmography.title: Glory Alley
filmography.role_description: A nightclub singer/dancer in New Orleans who is in love with a boxer.
filmography.plot: A boxer quits the ring before a big fight and struggles to regain his reputation and the love of his girlfriend.

filmography.title: Funny Bones
filmography.role_description: The mother of the protagonist in this quirky comedy about comedians.
filmography.plot: A failed comedian retreats to Blackpool to find the perfect act and uncovers family secrets.

filmography.title: Valentino
filmography.role_description: The silent film star and friend to Rudolph Valentino in Ken Russell's biopic.
filmography.plot: The life of Rudolph Valentino, the legendary silent film star, from his early days to his premature death.

filmography.title: The Doctor's Dilemma
filmography.role_description: The wife of a dying artist who must convince a doctor to save him over a worthy colleague.
filmography.plot: A doctor who has developed a cure for tuberculosis can only save one more patient and must choose between a talented but unscrupulous artist and a good-hearted doctor.

filmography.title: Damage
filmography.role_description: The mother of the betrayed wife in this intense drama about a destructive affair.
filmography.plot: A member of Parliament falls passionately in love with his son's fiancée, leading to a tragic affair.

filmography.title: The Man Who Loved Women
filmography.role_description: One of the many women involved with the protagonist in François Truffaut's comedy-drama.
filmography.plot: A man who is obsessed with women writes a book about his many romantic conquests.

filmography.title: Le Divorce
filmography.role_description: The matriarch of a French family involved in a complex divorce with an American woman.
filmography.plot: An American girl goes to Paris to visit her pregnant stepsister, only to find her abandoned by her French husband.

filmography.title: The Subterraneans
filmography.role_description: A neurotic French beatnik girl who has a turbulent affair with a writer in San Francisco.
filmography.plot: A writer falls in love with a French existentialist in the beatnik culture of San Francisco.

filmography.title: A Very Special Favor
filmography.role_description: A French psychologist who is tricked by a wealthy father into 'curing' his spinster daughter.
filmography.plot: A wealthy American asks a romantic Frenchman to seduce his daughter to help her overcome her spinsterhood, but the Frenchman consults a female psychologist instead.

filmography.title: Promise Her Anything
filmography.role_description: A young widow who hopes to marry her boss but is distracted by her neighbor.
filmography.plot: A young widow with a baby tries to find a new husband, but her bohemian neighbor complicates her plans.

filmography.title: Napoléon
filmography.role_description: A role in Sacha Guitry's epic historical film about the French Emperor.
filmography.plot: The life and loves of Napoleon Bonaparte, told through the eyes of Talleyrand.

filmography.title: Chandler
filmography.role_description: A government witness who becomes the target of a hitman who falls in love with her.
filmography.plot: A private eye is hired to protect a government witness, but realizes he has been set up.
